name.text: Citywide and Borough High School Fairs
name.html: Citywide and Borough High School Fairs

description.text:
CITYWIDE HIGH SCHOOL FAIR
Saturday, September 16Sunday, September 17
10am-3pm

Come anytime during the event to meet with schools from all five boroughs at the fair. 
Learn about High School Admissions at Introduction to High School Admissions Family Workshops starting at 10:15am and 12pm. Both workshops cover the same material as the Summer Family Workshops from July 2017. 
Learn about auditioning for art schools and programs at a presentation beginning at 1:30pm.

Brooklyn Technical High School29 Fort Greene PlaceBrooklyn NY 11217
Accessible entrance located on South Elliott Place between Lafayette Avenue and DeKalb Avenue.

BOROUGH HIGH SCHOOL FAIRS
Saturday, October 14Sunday, October 15
11am-3pm

Come anytime during the event to meet with schools from your borough at the fair. 
Learn about High School Admissions at Introduction to High School Admissions Family Workshops starting at 11:15am and 12:30pm. Both workshops cover the same material as the Summer Family Workshops from July 2017 and from the Citywide High School Fair in September 2017. 
Go to the Career and Technical Education: Pathways to College and Career Success Workshop at 2pm.

BronxDeWitt Clinton Educational Campus100 W Mosholu Parkway SouthBronx NY 10468
BrooklynEdward R. Murrow High School1600 Avenue LBrooklyn NY 11230
ManhattanMartin Luther King Jr. Educational Campus122 Amsterdam AvenueNew York NY 10023
QueensFrancis Lewis High School58-20 Utopia ParkwayFresh Meadows NY 11365
Staten Island Port Richmond High School85 St. Josephs AvenueStaten Island NY 10302
Interpretation services are available. To request an American Sign Language interpreter, call 718-935-2399 by September 10.

description.text:
The ProFound Webinar is a product of our Center for Training, Business and Leadership Excellence. For more information about this or other learning solutions, copy this link into your URL browser to visit us online: http://www.mitchcommgroup.com, or email us at center@mitchcommgroup.com.
Want to explore more online and digital learning solutions for your team? Check out our packaged learning solutions here: http://profoundskills.com/products.
By registering, you will be added to our distribution list and receive future webinar and training opportunity updates from the Center. You can opt out at any time by clicking the unsubscribe link in any received email.

description.text:
Update (November 16, 2016)
The event is complete! Registration is open to view the recordings of alll the sessions. 
Update (November 3, 2016):
Wow! We just crossed over the 6000 registration threshold! Thank you for speading the word. Let's get this party started... 
About the Conference
What: All Day DevOps, Live Online Global ConferenceTime: 15 time zones, 15 hours, 54 sessions, 3 keynotesWhen: November 15, 2016Where: Live, Online 
Post-conference registration is now open!
Description
November 15, 2016 saw the first truly global, online DevOps Conference: All Day DevOps. Starting at 4:00am EST time (9:00am GMT), continuing through 8:00pm EST (12:00 midnight GMT), there were three, simultaneous tracks, each track containing 18, 30-minute presentations, for a total of 27 hours of presentations.
Speakers from around the world will be participating in this first of its kind event. Timing for the conference is set for the EMEA sessions to begin at 9:00am London time, then move the concentration of presentations to the East Coast of the USA, ending with presentations in the West Coast of the USA. All sessions will be recorded, but you will need to register for the event in order to have access to the recordings.
Conference Tracks
There are three tracks: Modern Infrastructure, Automated Security and CI/CD. We’ll have 54 sessions plus 3 keynotes, on three tracks, running continuously for 15 hours. 
Track One: Modern Infrastructure
Modern Infrastructure Track Hosts and Moderators, James Wickett (Signal Sciences), Ernest Mueller (Alien Vault), Karthik Gaekwad (Oracle)
In this track, we will be discussing novel architectures, approaches, and tools for building out software and services. We are not looking for the standard approaches, but the way Infrastructure will be in the next 3-5 years.
Track Two: DevSecOps & Automated Security - Living the Dream
Automated Security Track Hosts and Moderators Milton Smith (Oracle) and Shannon Lietz (Intuit)
You have a well tuned development and delivery environment or your in the process of building one. AppSec is a top business concern. You moved DevSecOps from Big Foot and UFO’s to reality, you sold the dream to staff, and now it’s beginning to pay off. This track explores DevSecOps tools and techniques to build a successful automated security program.
Track Three: CI/CD - Continuous Everything
CI/CD Track Hosts and Moderators Derek Weeks (Sonatype) and Andi Mann (Splunk)
Continuous Delivery is not magic, but it does take the right effort. The most successful practitioners have taken pragmatic steps to reduce cycle times, improve collaboration, and build quality in without burning people out. This track asks you to share your front line experiences of building CI/CD pipelines, aligning key stakeholders, and measuring the results. Remember, what’s now an everyday experience for you, is awesome to other’s pursuing that path.
All Day DevOps Conference Organizers
The All Day DevOps Conference is organized by advocates in the DevOps community. We are working together to deliver a diversity of sessions and speakers from all over the world to show practical usage and technical solutions of DevOps in small and large enterprises.


James Wickett, Signal Sciences


Derek Weeks, Sonatype


Shannon Lietz, Intuit


Milton Smith, Oracle


Andi Mann, Splunk


Mark Miller, Sonatype


Ernest Mueller, Alien Vault


Karthik Gaekwad, Oracle


Ericka Caslin, Sonatype


 
FAQs: Things You Might be Wondering About
How will the sessions be delivered?
The sessions are delivered over Google Hangouts, allowing us to have an unlimited number of attendees on each of the three channels. We'll be able to utilized the automatic recording features that publish directly to YouTube once a session is completed.
What if I can't make it to all the sessions? Will there be recordings?
Yes. That's one of the advantages of doing a live online conference. We'll have recordings of all the sessions immediately after the conclusion of the event.
What if I can't make it at all? Can I still view the recordings?
Yes. You'll need to register for the conference in order to access the recordings after the event. Even if you know you're not going to be able to make it, please register so we can let you know where the recordings are located and how to access them.
Can I update my registration information?
Absolutely. As many times as you'd like. Just make sure we can get in touch with you through email. 
What is the refund policy?
A refund policy for a free ticket? That's an easy one. Yes!

Who is making All Day DevOps possible? You are! Check out our community sponsors and supporters.

Update (November 16, 2016)

The event is complete! Registration is open to view the recordings of alll the sessions. 

Update (November 3, 2016):

Wow! We just crossed over the 6000 registration threshold! Thank you for speading the word. Let's get this party started... 

About the Conference

What: All Day DevOps, Live Online Global Conference
Time: 15 time zones, 15 hours, 54 sessions, 3 keynotes
When: November 15, 2016
Where: Live, Online 

Post-conference registration is now open!

Description

November 15, 2016 saw the first truly global, online DevOps Conference: All Day DevOps. Starting at 4:00am EST time (9:00am GMT), continuing through 8:00pm EST (12:00 midnight GMT), there were three, simultaneous tracks, each track containing 18, 30-minute presentations, for a total of 27 hours of presentations.

Speakers from around the world will be participating in this first of its kind event. Timing for the conference is set for the EMEA sessions to begin at 9:00am London time, then move the concentration of presentations to the East Coast of the USA, ending with presentations in the West Coast of the USA. All sessions will be recorded, but you will need to register for the event in order to have access to the recordings.

Conference Tracks

There are three tracks: Modern Infrastructure, Automated Security and CI/CD. We’ll have 54 sessions plus 3 keynotes, on three tracks, running continuously for 15 hours. 

Track One: Modern Infrastructure

Modern Infrastructure Track Hosts and Moderators, James Wickett (Signal Sciences), Ernest Mueller (Alien Vault), Karthik Gaekwad (Oracle)

In this track, we will be discussing novel architectures, approaches, and tools for building out software and services. We are not looking for the standard approaches, but the way Infrastructure will be in the next 3-5 years.

Track Two: DevSecOps & Automated Security - Living the Dream

Automated Security Track Hosts and Moderators Milton Smith (Oracle) and Shannon Lietz (Intuit)

You have a well tuned development and delivery environment or your in the process of building one. AppSec is a top business concern. You moved DevSecOps from Big Foot and UFO’s to reality, you sold the dream to staff, and now it’s beginning to pay off. This track explores DevSecOps tools and techniques to build a successful automated security program.

Track Three: CI/CD - Continuous Everything

CI/CD Track Hosts and Moderators Derek Weeks (Sonatype) and Andi Mann (Splunk)

Continuous Delivery is not magic, but it does take the right effort. The most successful practitioners have taken pragmatic steps to reduce cycle times, improve collaboration, and build quality in without burning people out. This track asks you to share your front line experiences of building CI/CD pipelines, aligning key stakeholders, and measuring the results. Remember, what’s now an everyday experience for you, is awesome to other’s pursuing that path.

All Day DevOps Conference Organizers

The All Day DevOps Conference is organized by advocates in the DevOps community. We are working together to deliver a diversity of sessions and speakers from all over the world to show practical usage and technical solutions of DevOps in small and large enterprises.

  • James Wickett, Signal Sciences

  • Derek Weeks, Sonatype

  • Shannon Lietz, Intuit

  • Milton Smith, Oracle

  • Andi Mann, Splunk

  • Mark Miller, Sonatype

  • Ernest Mueller, Alien Vault

  • Karthik Gaekwad, Oracle

  • Ericka Caslin, Sonatype

 

FAQs: Things You Might be Wondering About

How will the sessions be delivered?

The sessions are delivered over Google Hangouts, allowing us to have an unlimited number of attendees on each of the three channels. We'll be able to utilized the automatic recording features that publish directly to YouTube once a session is completed.

What if I can't make it to all the sessions? Will there be recordings?

Yes. That's one of the advantages of doing a live online conference. We'll have recordings of all the sessions immediately after the conclusion of the event.

What if I can't make it at all? Can I still view the recordings?

Yes. You'll need to register for the conference in order to access the recordings after the event. Even if you know you're not going to be able to make it, please register so we can let you know where the recordings are located and how to access them.

Can I update my registration information?

Absolutely. As many times as you'd like. Just make sure we can get in touch with you through email. 

What is the refund policy?

A refund policy for a free ticket? That's an easy one. Yes!


Who is making All Day DevOps possible? You are! Check out our community sponsors and supporters.

description.text:
KIDS' WORLD/SMILES Workshops
 
Our goal is to aid in the spiritual development of children through biblically based creative play, activities and workshops.  With Kids' World, you can be spiritually fed in peace, knowing that your children are lovingly being cared for.
Days and Hours of Operation at MC and WC - Registration is required
Mondays, Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays – 6:30 pm to 9:00 pm
Saturdays – 10:00 am to 1:00 pm and 6:30 pm to 9:00 pm
Special Events:  Hours Vary based on Event
Reservation is required
Kids’ World requires all parents to register their child at least 7 days in advance prior to your class and/or event.  All children must be fully potty trained; ages are 3 to 12 years old. If you register your child and do not show within 30 minutes of your meeting time, your child’s space will be released.  If you have more than two No-shows with-in a 30 day period without notification we will be unable to offer Kids’ World services to you and your family for 90 days.  To avoid any no-show penalties please contact us via email at kidsworld@fbcglenarden.org at least 24 hours prior to cancellation. Please make your reservation at www.fbcglenardenkidsworld.eventbrite.com
 
Parent Volunteer Requirement
Kids’ World is primarily supported by volunteers.  Due to the large number of children we serve, it is mandatory that all parents who use Kids' World be required to perform service hours based on the following:
If you use Kids World:

Four or more times a month you are required to perform 12 service hours per year
Three times a month you are required to perform 9 service hours per year
Twice a month you are required to perform 6 service hours per year
Once a month you are required to perform 3 service hours per year

Unfortunately, if you are unable to volunteer, we will not be able to offer childcare to you and your family.
*Please Note:  We require that you sign up to volunteer for your first 2-3 service hours within the first month of your use of Kids World. If you sign up to volunteer and you do not show, your childcare services will be suspended until you perform the service hours you committed to. If you have questions or concerns you may email us at kidsworld@fbcglenarden.org. 
Click on the following link to sign-up to volunteer:   www.SignUpGenius.com/go/4090E49ACAA2AA13-volunteer
 
Pick-Up Policy
Late pick-up is defined as being over 10 minutes late picking up your child after Kids’ World has closed.  Parents will receive a verbal warning on the first offense.  On the second offense you will receive a written warning that will be filed with the Kids World Coordinator.  Any family with three late pick-ups in a three month period will be prohibited from using Kids’ World services for 90 days.
Discipline Policy
All parents will be given a discipline policy to read and sign.  Please note if your child’s behavior is not corrected after a third time, your child will be prohibited from using Kids World services for 90 days. After 90 days we will assess the situation to determine if it is feasible for your child to return to Kids world.

All parents will be given a discipline policy to read and sign.  Please note if your child’s behavior is not corrected after a third time, your child will be prohibited from using Kids World services for 90 days. After 90 days we will assess the situation to determine if it is feasible for your child to return to Kids world.

name.text: Be in with a chance to Win This House for £2, mortgage free
name.html: Be in with a chance to Win This House for £2, mortgage free

description.text:
Win this house
Win this family home, mortgage free
Space for all the family/friends and just relax, this could be yours.
What would you do with this house if you won it for £2? 
Make it your family home mortgage/rent free?  Rent it out and be on your way to becoming a property tycoon?  Sell it and pay off your current mortgage! Or perhaps help your children get on the property ladder.

How to Enter
To enter successfully please answer the following question :
In which year was this house first sold as a new build:
A. 2001
B. 2002
C. 2003

Both free and paid entry options are available.
Only entries with the correct answer will be entered into the draw.
Terms and Conditions apply

To participate via free entry please send a letter inside an envelope or on a postcard including your name, address, telephone number, email address (if applicable) and answer to our question by 1st class post to the  address on the Website, www.winthishouse.co.uk.
Please don't forget, to enter successfully please include the answer to the following question : 
In which year was this house first sold as a new build:
A. 2001
B. 2002
C. 2003
Please note, only ONE free entry will be entered into the competition per envelope or postcard received and per person, entries without correct and sufficient postage paid will not be accepted. Entries received after the competition deadline will not be included.
In the event that the competition winner cannot be contacted within 21 days after the end of the draw a new winner will be chosen at random.
By entering this competition you declare that you have read and agree to the terms and conditions of entry.

**Eventbrite is not a sponsor or administrator of, and is not in any way affiliated with, such event or activity.**
